website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for something with a lower price tag and weight limit, consider this model from Extreme Max. It has a 300 pound weight limit and is perfect for working on dirt bikes, small motorcycles, and 4-wheelers.
pros: Lifts dirt bikes, small motorcycles and other machines up to 34.5"
Padded rubber platform measures 16.25" x 13.25" and protects against slips and scratches
Raise and lower with foot pedal

customer_reviews.title: makes great general purpose platform lift
customer_reviews.text: I made a platform to set my pvc quadracycle frame on. When near max height it is unstable due to platform length / width so I put saw horses under platform. I originally bought this to lift an electric fat tire trike but I need to fabricate brackets to make the trike set on the lift. Only complaint is the lift pedal flops around, will bump the release pedal.
customer_reviews.author: JC Hobbes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for raising the beer fermenter
customer_reviews.text: I am using this device to elevate my 7 gallon beer fermenter when transferring beer to the keg. It's the perfect size and height. I am sure it would also work to elevate a motorcycle for repairs, but that is not how I am using it.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and small foot print.
customer_reviews.text: This is a hydraulic table for lifting or lowering heavy items. It has a small footprint and doesn't take a lot of room in my garage. Adjusting the down speed is sensitive. I had to do it in 1/8 to 1/4 turns to find the desired speed of descent. There is a safety crossbar that I will always use to prevent ugly accidents. I used self-adhesive velcro to attach it to the unit so it will always be handle.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jue

customer_reviews.title: Useful as general lifting tool
customer_reviews.text: I used it to lift a heavy air conditioner into place and it worked great. Since then I also used it to position a large replacement window for installation. Another review mentioned low clearance of the hydraulic cylinder mount. This is true and it snags on any irregularities in the floor when you'r rolling it. I just lived with it so far but it would be easily fixed with spacers on the castors. Not a huge problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all. DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: Pump the pedal and the platform does not raise at all. Going to be a huge pain to bring a 75lb package to UPS to send back.
customer_reviews.author: JBL

customer_reviews.title: Worth the few extra dollars
customer_reviews.text: Much nicer than the other knock-offs. First ordered a knockoff that advertised foot pedal’s but arrived with pedal lift and knob release. It didn’t even lift good with no load on it and had rough weld joints. Returned immediately. Ordered this and was noticeably better quality as soon as I opened the box. It has both pedals (lift and lowering) and works great. Worth the few extra dollars.
customer_reviews.author: DeVito Family

customer_reviews.title: Better that a big bike lift.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. 2 wheels have brake or lock so it won’t roll. Bike sits on plastic mat that holds it very well if you don’t want to lock it down. I had one of those big bike lifts but always had to put bike on stand for tire or suspension and if you don’t put on stand on bike lift had to use strap that always got in the way and couldn’t turn handle bars/front wheel. This is a much better set up for working on dirt bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and versatile lift
customer_reviews.text: I use this to work on a number of different things in my garage, anything from electric scooters to small aircraft designed to carry humans. It's great and works well. One thing that could be better is if there was a lock on each wheel, as it can move unexpectedly if there's any imperfections in the floor level.
customer_reviews.author: Alien Rides

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little lift here. I have a motorcycle but I use my center stand on the bike for basic maintenance. I bought this to make a TV stand I could roll around and raise up. It was exactly what I needed.. Its sturdy when raised up and does not take up much space really. I'm going to get one more because i found it helpful for some other things as well.
customer_reviews.author: Frank M. Ausiello

customer_reviews.title: I use it as a sculpting stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for me, but I don't use it for what it was made for. If you need a stand to work on any three dimensional object, it works great. I am a sculptor with a small studio and it is perfect for me, and much more economical than buying a stand through a sculpture supply house.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kingan

customer_reviews.title: A little extra packing could help contain parts. Shipping carriers are brutal!
customer_reviews.text: Just received my lift. So far from appearance everything looks good. The only issue noticeable is the foot paddle used for pumping the hydraulic lift. The life peddle in my opinion needs some type of support that prevents damaging it. The lift peddle has(in my opinion) entirely to much sway movement. All my parts were in shipping box. Package did arrive beat up some what but that’s shipping fault not sellers. On a rating level I give it a 10 so far!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Barker

customer_reviews.title: cycle stand
customer_reviews.text: It won't lift my bike it weighs 970 lbs, but I bought it to work on lawn mowers or amy thing that I can at a level easy to work at. I also use it sit on while working on my car breaks or changing tires (adjustable hight is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike lift
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction and lifts my 2005 YZ250 with ease. With it completely lowered it’s almost the perfect height to slide under my skid plate, I uncompress the rear suspension about 1/4” and roll the lift under the bike. At full height the bike is at a really good working height.
customer_reviews.author: Mortimer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile equipment uses.
customer_reviews.text: Using this to carry a trash can from the ground to the level of my van to be slide on for recycling. My back gave out.
customer_reviews.author: hawaiiannovice

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I used it as a lift table to install some electrical equipment and it got the job done nicely. Build quality is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good for push mowers or anything that size. i have a bad hip and it lets me work on stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad hip, needs replaced but until then I can have a seat and work on things at my comfort level.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We do not service motorcycles but do prototype development that requires an adjustable platform. We added an adjustable LED light and are good to go. I will order a second lift soon. One recommendation would be to add a way to store the left guard rod.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL REESE

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to keep our Honda 2000 generator on and be able to move while it is full. It enables us to load the generator into the back of the pickup and unload it with just one person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase in a long time
customer_reviews.text: I don't have the patients or the eyesight to be bent over anymore. This lift makes working on my motorcycles much easier. Buy it! It's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Tasty Wheat

customer_reviews.title: Great for fixing heavy electric scooter
customer_reviews.text: Great for fixing an adult scooter or heavy skateboard. Saves your back!
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Was hesitant, but very pleased with this lift.
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, was a bit hesitant to make this purchase based on some of the less favorable reviews. However, am very pleased with this product. I did not have any issues with the hydraulics, or instructions. I was also pleasantly surprised about how sturdy the stand is even at full extension with 200+ on top.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Barley

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and use and has a small footprint for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: G. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Nice lift. Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, lifted my 450 with no issue. Never again will i work on a bike kneeling.
customer_reviews.author: Trent K.

customer_reviews.title: Lift seems sturdy, too bad they didn't send any instructions on ...
customer_reviews.text: Lift seems sturdy, too bad they didn't send any instructions on how to get it to work. If they'll contact me to get me the user manual I'll redo my rating. Update: one of the castor wheels is complete broken. I almost had my dirtbike fall over on me while trying to move it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little lift table. It is very solid and well made and does exactly as advertised. Nice red paint!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Stamey

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I ordered a different brand and sent back. Didn’t even compare to Extreme Max. I’d definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Heyboob

customer_reviews.title: Up in the air
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be happier, works better than I thought it would, I use it for more than just my motorcycles. Easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Wood chuck

customer_reviews.title: Get your project ready for the first time you jack it up, cause that’s all you get
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap hydraulic jack. Only worked for first lift. Now I’m sweating my butt off working back on the floor. The concept is great, but there product isn’t!
customer_reviews.author: Customee

customer_reviews.title: worked good for a couple mounths
customer_reviews.text: I like the lift it worked good for a little while now the jack will not hold it falls down
customer_reviews.author: Pat Frazer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every single penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is great for small quads and even big Japanese dirt bikes. Handles my old school XR250R with ease. Sure wish that I have bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my dirtbikes
customer_reviews.text: Lifts them high enough, and can still roll it around the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

product_meta.title: Extreme Max 5001.5083 Hydraulic Motorcycle Lift Table – 300 lb.
product_meta.description: Lifting up to 300 lbs., the Hydraulic Motorcycle Lift Table is perfect for tinkering on your dirt bike or small motorcycle. Set your bike on the table, secure it through the foot pegs with the included fasteners and lift away with the easy-to-use foot pedal; no tools required. Rising to a maximum height of 34.5”, the lift table eliminates the need to stoop or kneel while working on your bike. Once the desired height is achieved, a locking bar secures the height, ensuring the lift never drops from accidental contact with the release pedal. All necessary hardware included. Lifted Height: 34.5". Collapsed Height: 13.25". Platform Dimensions: 16.25" Length x 13.25" Width. Lift Capacity: 300 lbs.
feature_bullets: Lift your dirt bike or small motorcycle up to 34.5”
Padded 16.25" x 13.25" rubber platform prevents the bike from scratching and scraping
Easy to use foot pedal operation for raising and lowering

specifications.Cover Included: Extreme Max 5001.5083 Hydraulic Motorcycle Lift Table – 300 lb.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars90 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
